headline: Layoffs are piling up, raising worker anxiety. Here are some companies that have cut jobs recently
summary: Others cite corporate restructuring more broadly — or, as seen with big names like Amazon, are redirecting money to investments like artificial intelligence.  In such cases, “it’s not so much AI directly taking jobs, but AI’s appetite for cash that might be taking jobs," said Jason Schloetzer, professor business administration at Georgetown University’s McDonough School.  Federal employees have encountered additional doses of uncertainty, impacting worker sentiment around the job market overall.

Federal employees have encountered additional doses of uncertainty, impacting worker sentiment around the job market overall.

headline: Assessing Procter & Gamble’s Valuation After Strong Q1 Results, Innovation Push, and Leadership Transition
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) shares have been getting attention after the company posted fiscal first-quarter results that surpassed expectations. The company reported growth across categories and offered an upbeat outlook on tariffs and restructuring. Investors are eyeing how ongoing innovation and leadership changes may shape future performance. See our latest analysis for Procter & Gamble. Shares of Procter & Gamble have moved modestly this year, with a year-to-date share price return of -8.58%...
